meanings.definition: A woman who is appointed to carry out the terms of a will.
meanings.sent1: The executrices diligently followed the instructions in the will.
meanings.sent2: After her grandmother passed away, the executrices ensured her final wishes were fulfilled.
meanings.sent3: The executrices joked that they were like modern-day fairy godmothers granting wishes.
meanings.sent4: The executrices were the guardians of the deceased's last wishes, like protectors of a sacred trust.
meanings.sent5: The executrices' role was crucial in ensuring the will was executed accurately and fairly.

meanings.sent1: The executrices gathered to discuss the distribution of the estate.
meanings.sent2: In the lawyer's office, the executrices signed the necessary documents.
meanings.sent3: At the will reading, the executrices realized they all wore the same color by coincidence.
meanings.sent4: The executrices stood united, a formidable force in carrying out the will's provisions.
meanings.sent5: The executrices' responsibilities multiplied as they worked together to fulfill the terms of the will.
